1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 module.exports = function(AV) {
  6   /**
  7    * Represents a Role on the AV server. Roles represent groupings of
  8    * Users for the purposes of granting permissions (e.g. specifying an ACL
  9    * for an Object). Roles are specified by their sets of child users and
 10    * child roles, all of which are granted any permissions that the parent
 11    * role has.
 12    *
 13    * <p>Roles must have a name (which cannot be changed after creation of the
 14    * role), and must specify an ACL.</p>
 15    * @class
 16    * A AV.Role is a local representation of a role persisted to the AV
 17    * cloud.
 18    */
 19   AV.Role = AV.Object.extend("_Role", /** @lends AV.Role.prototype */ {
 20     // Instance Methods
 21 
 22     /**
 23      * Constructs a new AVRole with the given name and ACL.
 24      *
 25      * @param {String} name The name of the Role to create.
 26      * @param {AV.ACL} [acl] The ACL for this role. if absent, the default ACL
 27      *    `{'*': { read: true }}` will be used.
 28      */
 29     constructor: function(name, acl) {
 30       if (_.isString(name)) {
 31         AV.Object.prototype.constructor.call(this, null, null);
 32         this.setName(name);
 33       } else {
 34         AV.Object.prototype.constructor.call(this, name, acl);
 35       }
 36       if (acl === undefined) {
 37         var defaultAcl = new AV.ACL();
 38         defaultAcl.setPublicReadAccess(true);
 39         acl = defaultAcl;
 40       }
 41       if (!(acl instanceof AV.ACL)) {
 42         throw new TypeError('acl must be an instance of AV.ACL');
 43       }
 44       this.setACL(acl);
 45     },
 46 
 47     /**
 48      * Gets the name of the role.  You can alternatively call role.get("name")
 49      *
 50      * @return {String} the name of the role.
 51      */
 52     getName: function() {
 53       return this.get("name");
 54     },
 55 
 56     /**
 57      * Sets the name for a role. This value must be set before the role has
 58      * been saved to the server, and cannot be set once the role has been
 59      * saved.
 60      *
 61      * <p>
 62      *   A role's name can only contain alphanumeric characters, _, -, and
 63      *   spaces.
 64      * </p>
 65      *
 66      * <p>This is equivalent to calling role.set("name", name)</p>
 67      *
 68      * @param {String} name The name of the role.
 69      * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
 70      *     callbacks.
 71      */
 72     setName: function(name, options) {
 73       return this.set("name", name, options);
 74     },
 75 
 76     /**
 77      * Gets the AV.Relation for the AV.Users that are direct
 78      * children of this role. These users are granted any privileges that this
 79      * role has been granted (e.g. read or write access through ACLs). You can
 80      * add or remove users from the role through this relation.
 81      *
 82      * <p>This is equivalent to calling role.relation("users")</p>
 83      *
 84      * @return {AV.Relation} the relation for the users belonging to this
 85      *     role.
 86      */
 87     getUsers: function() {
 88       return this.relation("users");
 89     },
 90 
 91     /**
 92      * Gets the AV.Relation for the AV.Roles that are direct
 93      * children of this role. These roles' users are granted any privileges that
 94      * this role has been granted (e.g. read or write access through ACLs). You
 95      * can add or remove child roles from this role through this relation.
 96      *
 97      * <p>This is equivalent to calling role.relation("roles")</p>
 98      *
 99      * @return {AV.Relation} the relation for the roles belonging to this
100      *     role.
101      */
102     getRoles: function() {
103       return this.relation("roles");
104     },
105 
106     /**
107      * @ignore
108      */
109     validate: function(attrs, options) {
110       if ("name" in attrs && attrs.name !== this.getName()) {
111         var newName = attrs.name;
112         if (this.id && this.id !== attrs.objectId) {
113           // Check to see if the objectId being set matches this.id.
114           // This happens during a fetch -- the id is set before calling fetch.
115           // Let the name be set in this case.
116           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
117               "A role's name can only be set before it has been saved.");
118         }
119         if (!_.isString(newName)) {
120           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
121               "A role's name must be a String.");
122         }
123         if (!(/^[0-9a-zA-Z\-_ ]+$/).test(newName)) {
124           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
125               "A role's name can only contain alphanumeric characters, _," +
126               " -, and spaces.");
127         }
128       }
129       if (AV.Object.prototype.validate) {
130         return AV.Object.prototype.validate.call(this, attrs, options);
131       }
132       return false;
133     }
134   });
135 };
136
